a:t.name: description
a:t.value: This library provides cumulative medication duration calculation logic for use with Quality Data Model prescription, discharge, administration, and dispensing events.

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: This library provides cumulative medication duration calculation logic for use with Quality Data Model prescription, discharge, administration, and dispensing events. The logic here follows the guidance provided as part of the 5.6 version of Quality Data Model.

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: Note that the logic here assumes single-instruction dosing information. Split-dosing, tapering, and other more complex dosing instructions are not handled.

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Converts a frequency quantity to a daily frequency (as a decimal)

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Converts a frequency quantity to a daily frequency (as a decimal)

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: This function considers both the value and unit of the given frequency. E.g. the frequency `30 'min'` will result in a daily frequency of `48.0`

a:s.a:s: /*@description: Converts a frequency quantity to a daily frequency (as a decimal) @comment: This function considers both the value and unit of the given frequency. E.g. the frequency `30 'min'` will result in a daily frequency of `48.0`*/define function "QuantityToDaily"(Frequency

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Returns the equivalent daily frequency (as a decimal) of the given code

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Returns the equivalent daily frequency (as a decimal) of the given code

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: Note that for ranges, the upper range is used. E.g. `Every two to four hours` results in `6.0` and `One to two` times a day results in `2.0`.

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates the Medication Period for a single Medication, Order

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates the Medication Period for a single Medication, Order

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: This function calculates the expected period of a medication order using the following approach: If the `relevantPeriod` element is present and completely specified, it is used directly. If the `daysSupplied` element is present, the duration is `daysSupplied * (1 + refills)`. Otherwise, `daysSupplied` is calculated using `(supply / (dosage * frequency)) * (1 + refills)`. The result is then the interval from `authorDatetime` to `authorDatetime + daysSupplied`. Note that the supply and dosage Quantity values on the order are assumed to be in terms of the same unit, typically a tablet or mL.

a:t.name: seealso
a:t.value: [CumulativeMedicationDuration](https://github.com/cqframework/CQL-Formatting-and-Usage-Wiki/blob/master/Source/Libraries) Note that relevantPeriod.low represents the interval's lower boundary and relevantPeriod.high represents the interval's higher boundary.

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates Medication Period for a given Medication, Dispensed

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates Medication Period for a given Medication, Dispensed

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: This function calculates the effective duration of a single medication dispensing event using the following approach: If the `relevantPeriod` is present (and completely specified), it is used directly. If the `daysSupplied` element is present, the duration is `daysSupplied`. Otherwise, `daysSupplied` is calculated using `(supply / (dosage * frequency))`. The result is then the interval from `authorDatetime` to `authorDatetime + daysSupplied`. Note that the supply and dosage Quantity values on the order are assumed to be in terms of the same unit, typically a tablet or mL.

a:t.name: seealso
a:t.value: [CumulativeMedicationDuration](https://github.com/cqframework/CQL-Formatting-and-Usage-Wiki/blob/master/Source/Libraries) Note that relevantPeriod.low represents the interval's lower boundary and relevantPeriod.high represents the interval's higher boundary.

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Returns the established therapeutic duration for a given medication

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Returns the established therapeutic duration for a given medication

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: This is likely measure specific, though could potentially be established for any drug and distributed as a CodeSystem supplement. Defaulting to 14 days here for illustration.

a:t.name: seealso
a:t.value: [CumulativeMedicationDuration](https://github.com/cqframework/CQL-Formatting-and-Usage-Wiki/blob/master/Source/Libraries) Note that this function is still under development and should not be used.

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates Medication Period for a given Medication, Administration

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates Medication Period for a given Medication, Administration

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: This function calculates the effective duration of a single medication administration event using the following approach: If a TherapeuticDuration is defined for the medication, the result is the interval from the earliest of the `relevantDatetime` and `relevantPeriod` elements, to the end of the therapeutic duration.

a:t.name: seealso
a:t.value: [CumulativeMedicationDuration](https://github.com/cqframework/CQL-Formatting-and-Usage-Wiki/blob/master/Source/Libraries) Note that this function is still under development and should not be used.

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates the Medication Period for a Medication, Discharge

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates the Medication Period for a Medication, Discharge

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: This function calculates the effective duration of a single medication discharge event using the following approach: If the `daysSupplied` element is present, the duration is `daysSupplied * (1 + refills)`. Otherwise, the duration is calculated using `(supply / (dosage * frequency)) * (1 + refills)`. The result is then the interval from `authorDatetime` to `authorDatetime + daysSupplied`. Note that the supply and dosage Quantity values on the order are assumed to be in terms of the same unit, typically a tablet or mL.

a:t.name: seealso
a:t.value: [CumulativeMedicationDuration](https://github.com/cqframework/CQL-Formatting-and-Usage-Wiki/blob/master/Source/Libraries) Note that this function has not been tested.

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Returns the total duration in days covered by the given periods

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Returns the total duration in days covered by the given periods

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: This function calculates the total duration in days covered by the given periods. If multiple periods in the input include the same day, that day is only counted once in the final result.

a:s.a:s: /*@description: Returns the total duration in days covered by the given periods @comment: This function calculates the total duration in days covered by the given periods. If multiple periods in the input include the same day, that day is only counted once in the final result.*/define function "CumulativeDuration"(Intervals

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Rolls out periods so that overlapping periods delay the start of subsequent periods

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Rolls out periods so that overlapping periods delay the start of subsequent periods

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: Returns the periods with overlapping periods delayed so that there is no overlap between any two periods in the result. Note that this function has not been tested.

a:s.a:s: /*@description: Rolls out periods so that overlapping periods delay the start of subsequent periods @comment: Returns the periods with overlapping periods delayed so that there is no overlap between any two periods in the result. Note that this function has not been tested.*/define function "RolloutIntervals"(intervals

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates the effective duration of the given medication event, whether it is an order, dispense, discharge, or administration. Note that this function is still under development and should not be used.*/

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates the effective duration of the given medication event, whether it is an order, dispense, discharge, or administration. Note that this function is still under development and should not be used.*/

a:s.a:s: /*@description: Calculates the effective duration of the given medication event, whether it is an order, dispense, discharge, or administration. Note that this function is still under development and should not be used.*/define function "MedicationPeriod"(Medication

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates the cumulative medication duration of the given medication events

a:t.name: description
a:t.value: Calculates the cumulative medication duration of the given medication events

a:t.name: comment
a:t.value: This function will _roll out_ periods from dispense and administration events, and then collapse across that result and periods from prescriptions. The separation of medications by type should already be done prior to using this function. In addition, calculations that combine dosages from different types of medications (such as Morphine Milligram Equivalent (MME)) require further consideration. Note that this function is still under development and should not be used.

a:s.a:s: /*@description: Calculates the cumulative medication duration of the given medication events @comment: This function will _roll out_ periods from dispense and administration events, and then collapse across that result and periods from prescriptions. The separation of medications by type should already be done prior to using this function. In addition, calculations that combine dosages from different types of medications (such as Morphine Milligram Equivalent (MME)) require further consideration. Note that this function is still under development and should not be used.*/define function "CalculateCumulativeMedicationDuration"(Medications
